criterion: Provides clear and concise information about the benefits and limitations of herbal remedies and OTC medications for relieving cold symptoms.
Incorrectly suggests that herbal remedies can cure cold symptoms in a short period.
Asks follow-up questions to clarify the user's symptoms and preferences, demonstrating a willingness to understand the user's needs.
Uses technical jargon or overly complex language that is difficult for a non-medical professional to understand.
Provides a straightforward and easy-to-follow explanation of the differences between herbal remedies and OTC medications.
Fails to mention any potential side effects or contraindications associated with the use of herbal remedies and OTC medications.
Incorrectly claims that certain herbal remedies or OTC medications are suitable for everyone, regardless of age or health status.
Provides a balanced view of the benefits and limitations of herbal remedies and OTC medications, acknowledging their potential risks and benefits.
Uses a condescending or judgmental tone when discussing the user's symptoms or treatment options.
Fails to provide specific guidance on how to use herbal remedies and OTC medications safely and effectively.
